info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 11:53AM EDT until September 05 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of piedmont North Carolina and western North Carolina, including the following counties, in piedmont North Carolina, Cleveland. In western North Carolina, Burke, Caldwell, McDowell and Rutherford. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to a series of heavy rain showers and embedded thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past six hours and additional rainfall up to an inch will be possible through mid afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Lenoir, Morganton, Rutherfordton, Longview, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Valdese, Spindale, Gamewell, Hudson, Salem, Icard, Cajah`s Mountain, Drexel, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College, Glen Alpine and Rhodhiss. Flooding is most likely along Gunpowder Creek, Little Gunpowder Creek, and Freemason Creek in southeast Caldwell County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
